TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SessionStateType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Describes the session-state type used when installing a session-state database provider.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the SessionStateType enumeration with the <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices.InstallSessionState%2A> method of the <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> type.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Management.SqlServices#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.management._0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Management.SqlServices#8](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.management._0_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Management.SessionStateType Custom = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Session-state data and stored procedures are placed in a custom data store.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Management.SessionStateType Persisted = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Session-state data and stored procedures are placed in the "ASPState" database. Session-state data will survive a restart of the database server.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Management.SessionStateType Temporary = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Session state data is stored in tempdb, and stored procedures are placed in the "ASPState" database. Session state data will not survive a restart of SQL Server.
